intro: Ortostachys recta, commonly known as the upright sedge, is a perennial plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes and wetlands. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Ortostachys recta is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil in aquatic environments.
